sentences.en: He could not restrain an exclamation of approval.
I can't restrain them from going their own way.
sentences.cn: 我不能阻止他们走自己的路.

sentences.en: I had to restrain her from running out into the street.
sentences.cn: 我只得阻止她跑到街上去。

sentences.en: I had to restrain myself from telling him what I thought of him.
sentences.cn: 我不得不克制自己,不告诉他我对他的想法.

sentences.en: I must learn to restrain myself, eg not say what I think.
If you can't restrain your dog you must lock it up.
sentences.cn: 如果你无法管住你的狗,就必须把它关起来.

sentences.en: Price rises should restrain consumer spending.
sentences.cn: 价格上涨会抑制消费支出。

sentences.en: Renwick restrained a feeling of annoyance.
sentences.cn: 伦威克忍住了不悦的情绪。

sentences.en: She shouldn't restrain her anger at this insensible attitude of theirs.
sentences.cn: 对他们这种无动于衷的态度,她抑制不住心头的怒火.

sentences.en: She sobbed aloud, not caring to restrain her grief.
sentences.cn: 她大声地啜泣, 不打算遏止悲哀.

sentences.en: She was unable to restrain her desperate anger.
sentences.cn: 她无法控制自己极度的愤怒。

sentences.en: The child was unable to restrain her tears.
sentences.cn: 那孩子不能制止住她的眼泪.
他们无法抑制自己的激动.

sentences.en: Unable to restrain herself, she rose and went to the phone.
sentences.cn: 她没能克制住自己，起身走向电话。

sentences.en: Wally gripped my arm, partly to restrain me and partly to reassure me.
sentences.cn: 沃利抓住我的手臂，一是想制止我，二是想稳住我。

sentences.en: With an effort I managed to restrain my incredulous laughter.
sentences.cn: 我好不容易才忍住不笑出来,因为他的话令人难以置信.

words.tran_cn: 克制的，受限制的；拘谨的
[摄] 抑制剂（尤指摄影中用的溴化钾等）；限制器；控制者

trans.tran_en: to stop someone from doing something, often by using physical force

trans.tran_cn: 抑制，压抑，限定，限制，制止，监禁
trans.tran_en: to stop someone from doing something, often by using physical force
